lines.text:
[Speculating on Miss Marple]
I wonder what she's like.
She's elderly, so she'll be punctual.

[Talking about the murdered girl]
There was something in her nature.
Do you believe in such things?
Oh, yes... yes. I believe in evil, in everlasting life, and oh. yes, goodness... yes.
Archdeacon, there's someone I'd like you to meet. There she is...

. Mr. Rafiel's bloodhound - his avenging angel. She looks so harmless, doesn't she? But her camouflage is perfect because she is partly just what she seems - a gossipy old village lady, but her logic is ruthless and her powers of synthesis formidable. And above all she never lets go.

[as bedroom door opens]
Good evening, Miss Bradbury-Scott.

[turns round in surprise to see Miss Marple sitting in an armchair]
I saw your light on, I wondered if...
Well I haven't I'm afraid. I didn't think it would be good for me. I think you know what I mean.
If you want some more milk I'll go and get it for you.
I shouldn't drink it if you did!

It's up to her now. Thousand of years ago she had a measuring rod, a sword, and a whip. Yes, it was called a scourge. She rode about in a chariot drawn by griffins. Nemesis. Last time I saw her, she was wearing a pink, woolly shawl.
